transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Hi there, folks, this is Tansut, welcome to Space Ghost Coast to Coast. Tonight's guest is Beck. That's it, just Beck. My work is done here, I'm going home. (remains silent during rest of theme & titles) Oh yeah, here's, uh, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings! I'm Space Ghost. Joining me tonight is guitarist/musician Beck. Also, I will blast Zorak repeatedly for busting up my apartment earlier this afternoon.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm back.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, thanks for joining us, Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No problem.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're a little late.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, I've been breaking your stuff.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, I know.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (sighs and rolls his eyes) I got tired near the end, so I lit a big fire. That's why I'm late.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did the flames consume all my posessions?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Everything but your hand-painted Presidents of the United States ceramic figurines collection.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, really?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I had to crush that with a hammer.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (long pause) (in low voice) You know I'm going to have to do something about this, don't you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Go ahead, I'll just regenerate.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (crisped) See? Fried now, (cut to Space Ghost, still aiming) cut away, (cut back to normal looking Zorak) back to normal! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts him again)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (crisped) Oh, you can do better than that! Think of the figurines! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This is for tiny Abraham Lincoln! (blasts him again)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Now, wait...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And this is for tiny George Washington! (blasts him again)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And this is for tiny Millard Fillmore (blasts him again)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Wait, you're not giving him time to regenerate! (control room monitor: ONE TURNTABLE AND TWO MICROPHONES)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And this is for tiny Jimmy Carter! (blasts him again)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Stop! Stop!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And this is for tiny Rutherford B. Hayes! (blasts him again)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looking especially crisped, eyes closed)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Are ya done yet? (control room monitor: SWORD OR MATADOR?)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (panting) No! Did I do Chester Allan Arthur?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What about Grover Cleveland?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Twice.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about I give him one to grow on?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: IIIII think he's learned his lesson.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts him one last time; smoke rises from empty keyboard pod)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, that's just super! Zorak's dead!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yes, Space Ghost, he is.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You say that like it's my fault.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It is your fault, you blasted him too many times.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, I didn't.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yes, you did.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, I didn't!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yes, you did! (control room monitor: PAPA'S GOT A BRAND NEW BAG)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (with anguish) Heaven help me! What have I done?!? (normal voice) Oh, well...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Should I... call the morgue or somethin'? (control room monitor: HUGHES ???? KU 77TH)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nope, play me to the desk.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What!? How am I supposed to do that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I've prepared for this inevitability. To your left you will find a songbook. Open that songbook.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (looking at book) This, is this it? "Don Hester's Flip and Learn Song Book for the Wee Piano Player, Volume One"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Exactly. Now start singing.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Y'know, I'm a little shy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Get over it. Page 12, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (groans) (sings, all one note) This is the note called mid-dle C, this is how it sounds to me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Please welcome my first guest)

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor, as it lowers from ceiling) Oh, thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Identify yourself.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: My name is Beck Hansen, a musician, a human being, um, et cetera.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost would like to speak with Beck in the third person. Would Beck like that?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that would be nice, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost is glad that Beck feels this way.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Third person is always a good way to, to approach the second and first persons...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, Space Ghost couldn't agree more.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: The kind of menage thing is good, too.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Citizen Beck, expound on your freak-like manner.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Well... (pauses)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, what?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: I like to plug things in, and then I like to unplug them, and then I go to sleep. What do you think about that, Moltar? Looks like you're plugged in all the time. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar is unplugged tonight, Beck.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Allow me to demonstrate. Moltar, turn to page 23.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (groans) Oh, man! I hate this one!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Take us to the bridge, Moltar. The London bridge.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Alright, alright... (control room monitor: DESTRY RIDES AGAIN)London bridge is falling down,Falling down, falling down,London bridge is falling down,My fair lady.

transcript.speaker: (Control room monitor
transcript.dialogue: ?? THE TRANSPONDER HOTLINES)

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (while Moltar is singing) You like that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who doesn't?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: It's a good tune.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Taco?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Oh, if you, if you have one, that would be nice.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, release the taco.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (pulls LUNCH lever) (Pop!)

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (catches Taco Bell wrapped taco) Of course, Space Ghost would always have a taco. Oh, thanks for the extra cheese there. (smells it) That doesn't look too friendly, actually.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, it's been sitting on my dashboard for a few days.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I can smell it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Man, Zorak used to love tacos.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Here, maybe Zorak would like that. Here you go!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak is dead, Beck.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (looks back silently)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I exterminated him.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (looks back uncomfortably)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Of course I found an excellent replacement. Haven't I, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I gotta go, fix the deal. (starts to walks away) (control room monitor: ?? THREAT OR MENACE?)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do another one, do a German one.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (groans) "Deutschland Mein Deutschland"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I know, "Du, Du, Liegst Mir im Herzen".

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Should I get my helmet on first?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Vaßever floatzen das boot.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (puts on his "helmet", which is actually a lampshade) Alright, let me have it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, commence.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (while Moltar sings) You don't mind if I take a nap, do you? It's been a long tour. I'm just gonna stretch out for a while. (leans back & closes his eyes)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sings) Du, du liegst mir im Herzen; du, du liegst mir im Sinn.Du, du machst mir viel Schmerzen, weißt nicht wie gut ich dir bin.Ja, ja, ja, ja, ...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ja, ja, ja, ja, weißt nicht wie gut ich dir bin.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That was beautiful, Moltar, where'd you learn to sing like that?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Juilliard.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shhh shhh, look, he's still asleep. (Beck is snoring on the monitor)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Doesn't he look cute with his little hat on?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) Shhh, quiet, you're gonna wake him up.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Let's put a pillow over his face.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No!!

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (wakes up, takes off his "helmet") Mmmm, that was, ahhh, thanks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How does Beck feel?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: I feel so refreshed. That was very rejuventating.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, you're a musician, right?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And, you have a band, correct?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I'm, I got a band. We got, we got Stagecoach on the drums...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (scoots chair forward, then scoots back & forth as Beck talks)

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: We have Smokestack on guitar. Uh, Hound Dog is playin' the keyboards. And, uh, we have Showboat playin' the bass.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Brainwave: what if you guys were to come up here, and be my new house band?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (long pause) (sighs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sings) I got two turntables and my mommy's home.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Uh, well, we don't have turntables right now.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost would be down with Beck being his new band leader.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: I am down with that. Me too.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't bust up people's stuff for no apparent reason, do you?

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: No, I don't, I don't, I don't do that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: I don't play that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because I think that would be very old school of you.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: It's old school.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And Space Ghost would not play that.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah, you don't play, play that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, I don't. Space Ghost is not down with that.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: That's old school. I'm not, I'm not down with that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And Space Ghost would have to dispose of you.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Right, right, right.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeeaaah! Zorak! Where did you come from?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Downstairs.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Man, I thought you were dead!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Nah, I regenerated and went downstairs.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know, Space Ghost thinks he killed ya.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Really! (evil laugh) Well, I'm gonna go out there and mess with his head!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, Beck, you have a tag.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: How's that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You got a tag on your pants.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Oh, thanks. There we go. (cuts off tag with a pair of scissors) Thanks for bringing that to my attention there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You must be quite embarrassed.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: 'Cause you know, you had a tag.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It just sorta made you look foolish.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's goin' on?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (eerie voice) Ooooooooh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (fearfully) Zorak! You're dead! I vaporized you!

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, how ya doin'?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (eerie voice) Fiiiine! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What do you want of me, O spectre?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Toniiiight, you will be visited by threeee spirits! The first will.. mess with the lights! (flickflickflickflick) The next will screw with your monitor! (Beck disappears from monitor, Zorak takes his place) Hi, how's it goin'?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaaaah! (Beck returns to monitor) Wh-wh-what about the third?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh, the third, uh... He will also mess with the lights! (flickflickflickflickflickflickflickflick)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Stop it, vile apparition! You're going to break the switch!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ooooooh! (flickflickflick--poof! click) Oops! (click...click) Must have blown a fuse.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: See?? Look what ya done now!

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (snores)

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: BECK HANSEN / POPULAR MUSICIAN) The past is a cancelled check. Your maximum point of power is now.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: BRAK / TV'S "BRAK") Stop stumblin' around in the dark, and stubbin' your toe on financial ruin! Turn the light on!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wonder what these people are talking about? Listen to another testimonial.

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: DAVID LANDER / TV's "SQUIGGY") Hello.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, you too will be saying (subtitle: "HELLO, MONEY!") hello to money, and (subtitle: "HELLO, LIFE!") hello to life, with my (subtitle: NOT SOLD IN ANY STORE!) new twelve week program. (subtitle: LIFETIME GUARANTEE!) But don't take my word for it!

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: STAY TUNED FOR FREE TRIAL OFFER!) And in the twelve week plan, you know, I broke through, it all happened like that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: GERMAN CRAFTSMAN AWARD FOR EXCELLENCE!) That was triple Grammy award winning rock musician Beck. (subtitle: FITS ANY 8-TRACK TAPE PLAYER!) Here's some more testimonials.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: TANSUT / TV's "THE FALL GUY") Now, I finally have enough money to live my dream... (subtitle: MAKE A CHANGE!) as a woman!

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (on studio monitor, subtitle: COMES WITH 7-PAGE PAMPHLET!) I bought about thirty-five thousand acres, and (subtitle: SOME ASSEMBLY REQUIRED!) uh, for, you know, sixty cents an acre, (subtitle: ALL TAPES ARE SHINY AND NEW! [words sparkle]) and in about twelve minutes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: SPACE GHOST NODS KNOWINGLY!) Mmm hmm.

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: MR. HANSEN'S RESULTS ARE TYPICAL!) My profits have gone up six thousand percent, (subtitle: YOUR RESULTS MAY VARY.) and it was all because of the tapes.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: "I SAW THE TAPES! BOY, OH BOY!!" - TV's "BRAK") I saw the tapes! Boy, oh boy!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Need I say more? What are you waiting for? With just three easy payments of $79.95 (superimposed, in a flashing star: A $22000 VALUE) you too can have my twelve week program. (subtitle: CALL NOW!) Just pick up the phone and call! It's that easy!

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: DAVID LANDER / TV's "SQUIGGY") I'll see it when I believe it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Believe it, Squiggy! And believe in your cash ability!

transcript.speaker: Beck
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: TAPES ENCASED IN DELUXE PLASTIC!) See, I didn't have a tape machine, I just had the tapes. So, (subtitle: AS SEEN ON TV!) I mean, if I got to listen to the tapes, I would really be makin' some, some headway.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (subtitle: SORRY, NO C.O.D.s!) I order you to order now! (aims his power band)
